00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003   Name:         ebfe.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt / Pierre-Andre Amaudruz
00005 
00006   Contents:     Frontend code for mevb example.
00007                 Source code taken from the frontend.c example.
00008                 Modification of:
00009                 *frontend_name
00010                 Trigger eqp name : Trigger1
00011                 Scaler  eqp name : Scaler1
00012                 Trigger eqp buffer name : BUF1
00013                 Added cm_yield(10) in the poll_event()
00014                 data rate reduction.
00015                 
00016                 Simplified the event generator and should be linked
00017                 with the camacnul driver for the mevb example.
00018                 But nothing prevent to generate real event using
00019                 proper driver.

00103    EQUIPMENT equipment[] = {
00104 
00105       {"Trigger",              /* equipment name */
00106        1, TRIGGER_ALL,         /* event ID, trigger mask */
00107        "BUF",                  /* event buffer */
00108 #ifdef USE_INT
00109        EQ_INTERRUPT,            /* equipment type */
00110 #else
00111        EQ_POLLED | EQ_EB,       /* equipment type */
00112 #endif
00113        LAM_SOURCE(0, 0xFFFFFF), /* event source crate 0, all stations */
00114        "MIDAS",                 /* format */
00115        TRUE,                    /* enabled */
00116        RO_RUNNING |             /* read only when running */
00117        RO_ODB,                  /* and update ODB */
00118        500,                     /* poll for 500ms */
00119        0,                       /* stop run after this event limit */
00120        0,                       /* number of sub events */
00121        0,                       /* don't log history */
00122        "", "", "",
00123        read_trigger_event,      /* readout routine */
00124        },
00125

00127        2, TRIGGER_ALL,         /* event ID, trigger mask */
00128        "BIF",                  /* event buffer */
00129        EQ_PERIODIC | EQ_EB | 
00130        EQ_MANUAL_TRIG,    /* equipment type */
00131        0,                       /* event source */
00132        "MIDAS",                 /* format */
00133        TRUE,                    /* enabled */
00134        RO_RUNNING | RO_TRANSITIONS |    /* read when running and on transitions */
00135        RO_ODB,                  /* and update ODB */
00136        10000,                   /* read every 10 sec */
00137        0,                       /* stop run after this event limit */
00138        0,                       /* number of sub events */
00139        0,                       /* log history */
00140        "", "", "",
00141        read_scaler_event,       /* readout routine */

00150 /********************************************************************\
00151               Callback routines for system transitions
00152 
00153   These routines are called whenever a system transition like start/
00154   stop of a run occurs. The routines are called on the following
00155   occations:
00156 
00157   frontend_init:  When the frontend program is started. This routine
00158                   should initialize the hardware.
00159   
00160   frontend_exit:  When the frontend program is shut down. Can be used
00161                   to releas any locked resources like memory, commu-
00162                   nications ports etc.
00163 
00164   begin_of_run:   When a new run is started. Clear scalers, open
00165                   rungates, etc.
00166 
00167   end_of_run:     Called on a request to stop a run. Can send 
00168                   end-of-run event and close run gates.
00169 
00170   pause_run:      When a run is paused. Should disable trigger events.
00171 
00172   resume_run:     When a run is resumed. Should enable trigger events.
00173 \********************************************************************/
00174 INT frontend_init()
00175 {
00176   /* Compose expected bank name under Ebuilder */
00177   sprintf(Adcx, "AD%02d", get_frontend_index());
00178   sprintf(Tdcx, "TC%02d", get_frontend_index());
00179   sprintf(Sclx, "SC%02d", get_frontend_index());
00180 
00181   /* hardware initialization */
00182 
00183   cam_init();
00184   cam_crate_clear(CRATE);
00185   cam_crate_zinit(CRATE);
00186 
00187   /* enable LAM in IO unit */
00188   camc(CRATE, SLOT_IO, 0, 26);
00189 
00190   /* enable LAM in crate controller */
00191   cam_lam_enable(CRATE, SLOT_IO);
00192 
00193   /* reset external LAM Flip-Flop */
00194   camo(CRATE, SLOT_IO, 1, 16, 0xFF);
00195   camo(CRATE, SLOT_IO, 1, 16, 0);
00196 
00197   /* print message and return FE_ERR_HW if frontend should not be started */
00198 
00199   return SUCCESS;
00200 }
00201 
00202 /*-- Frontend Exit -------------------------------------------------*/
00203 INT frontend_exit()
00204 {
00205   return SUCCESS;
00206 }

00231    return SUCCESS;

00234 /*-- Frontend Loop -------------------------------------------------*/
00235 INT frontend_loop()
00236 {
00237   /* if frontend_call_loop is true, this routine gets called when
00238   the frontend is idle or once between every event */
00239   return SUCCESS;
00240 }

00243 /********************************************************************\
00244 
00245 Readout routines for different events
00246 
00247 \********************************************************************/
00248 
00249 /*-- Trigger event routines ----------------------------------------*/
00250 
00251 INT poll_event(INT source, INT count, BOOL test)
00252 /* Polling routine for events. Returns TRUE if event
00253 is available. If test equals TRUE, don't return. The test
00254 flag is used to time the polling */
00255 {
00256   int i;
00257   DWORD lam;
00258 
00259   for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
00260     cam_lam_read(LAM_SOURCE_CRATE(source), &lam);
00261     cm_yield(10);
00262     if (lam & LAM_SOURCE_STATION(source))
00263       if (!test)
00264         return lam;
00265   }
00266 
00267   return 0;
00268 }
00269 
00270 /*-- Interrupt configuration ---------------------------------------*/
00271 
00272 INT interrupt_configure(INT cmd, INT source, PTYPE adr)
00273 {
00274    switch (cmd) {
00275    case CMD_INTERRUPT_ENABLE:
00276       break;
00277    case CMD_INTERRUPT_DISABLE:
00278       break;
00279    case CMD_INTERRUPT_ATTACH:
00280       break;
00281    case CMD_INTERRUPT_DETACH:
00282       break;
00283    }
00284    return SUCCESS;
00285 }
00286 
00287 /*-- Event readout -------------------------------------------------*/
00288 
00289 INT read_trigger_event(char *pevent, INT off)
00290 {
00291    WORD *pdata, a;
00292    INT q, timeout;
00293 
00294    /* init bank structure */
00295    bk_init(pevent);
00296 
00297    /* create ADC bank */
00298    bk_create(pevent, Adcx, TID_WORD, &pdata);
00299 
00300    /* read ADC bank */
00301    for (a = 0; a < N_ADC; a++)
00302       *pdata++ = a + 10;
00303 
00304    /* clear ADC */
00305    camc(CRATE, SLOT_ADC, 0, 9);
00306 
00307    bk_close(pevent, pdata);
00308 
00309    /* create TDC bank */
00310    bk_create(pevent, Tdcx, TID_WORD, &pdata);
00311 
00312    /* read TDC bank */
00313    for (a = 0; a < N_TDC; a++)
00314       *pdata++ = a + 20;
00315 
00316    /* clear TDC */
00317    camc(CRATE, SLOT_TDC, 0, 9);
00318 
00319    bk_close(pevent, pdata);
00320 
00321    /* clear IO unit LAM */
00322    camc(CRATE, SLOT_IO, 0, 10);
00323 
00324    /* clear LAM in crate controller */
00325    cam_lam_clear(CRATE, SLOT_IO);
00326 
00327    /* reset external LAM Flip-Flop */
00328    camo(CRATE, SLOT_IO, 1, 16, 0xFF);
00329    camo(CRATE, SLOT_IO, 1, 16, 0);
00330 
00331    return bk_size(pevent);
00332 }
00333 
00334 /*-- Scaler event --------------------------------------------------*/
00335 
00336 INT read_scaler_event(char *pevent, INT off)
00337 {
00338    DWORD *pdata, a;
00339 
00340    /* init bank structure */
00341    bk_init(pevent);
00342 
00343    /* create SCLR bank */
00344    bk_create(pevent, Sclx, TID_DWORD, &pdata);
00345 
00346    /* read scaler bank */
00347    for (a = 0; a < N_SCLR; a++)
00348       cam24i(CRATE, SLOT_SCLR, a, 0, pdata++);
00349 
00350    bk_close(pevent, pdata);
00351 
00352    return bk_size(pevent);
00353 }
